lines.text: You've sent many a man to death... Are you ready for your sentence?

[nodding]
What is the verdict, doctor?
You may live a day... or a month... but not longer... and may the Lord have mercy on your soul!

[after Conn's wedding]
I have closed the book of my life... there is no appeal.
You've been a hard man, James O'Brien, and there's a curse on you...
[referring to the D'Arcy marriage he has forced on Conn]
I did what I thought was best... pray God I was right...

[to Hogan, turning down a knife as his dueling weapon]
Cold steel freezes my hand. I can't touch it.
Ireland - such a little place to be so greatly loved.
Conn, I'm asking your father tonight for the hand of you... to go with your heart.

[bitterly to D'Arcy]
I was known as the daughter of Jimmy, the Hangman... but that was better than wife to D'Arcy, the Informer!

[Standing at the officer's mess after receiving a telegram]
Sir, I must ask leave of absence to return home at once.
Home? To Ireland?

[Hogan nods]
To Ireland... where there's a price on your head... why run such a risk?

[after a long pause]
I've got to kill a man.

[standing and saluting Hogan]
Vive le Commandant!
Hangman's House - where if you've an ear for it, you can gear the howling of the hanged.

[Referring to D'Arcy's death]
Dermot McDermot, a great yellow stain has gone from the green of Ireland.
Aren't you the D'Arcy who just left Paris?

[shakes his head]
I've never been to Paris in my life.

[nods]
You haven't been to Hell yet, either... have you?

[to D'Arcy after he has shot the horse and threatened by an irate crowd]
Get into the lorry before they tear you to pieces. If I wasn't on duty, I'd enjoy the sight.
